body:
Follow the Java Quickstart for Google Drive REST APIs here - https://developers.google.com/drive/v3/web/quickstart/java

Summary of the steps from the above link -

Development environment - Java 1.7+, Gradle 2.3+, a Google account with Google Drive enabled

Step 1: Create a project in Google Developers Console and Turn on the Drive API

Step 2: Prepare the project - download required dependencies, setup your gradle build

The following libraries are specifically needed

compile 'com.google.api-client:google-api-client:1.22.0'
compile 'com.google.oauth-client:google-oauth-client-jetty:1.22.0'
compile 'com.google.apis:google-api-services-drive:v3-rev48-1.22.0'

Step 3: Set up the sample; write the code to authenticate your app to upload files to user's Google Drive

Step 4: Run the sample
title: What libraries I have to use for uploading the files to GOOGLE DRIVE
